review_title: 6 month co-op was an amazing experience
job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Lynn, MA
pros: I worked here while in college as a co-op. I worked in Operations and gained a lot of insight and practice to the application of business improvement projects. It was a great environment for learning.
cons: The area is a little sketchy, I never had any problems or bad instances, but there are no swanky offices, snack bars, or cool work environments.

job_title: Patient Appointment Clerk in Lynn, MA
pros: Diversity, being able to support a community
cons: Was told to keep negative comments to myself

review_title: Great community, poorly run HR DEPT
pros: School based health Center is an awesome place to get therapy experience with kids in a school setting on the school schedule. I love collaborating with school staff and having the convenience of calling the kids down for sessions during the school day. It really is an excellent program and opportunity to gain skills with child/adolescent population.
cons: Lots of challenges with HR, getting credentialed, getting personal health insurance , etc..

pros: flexibility, supportive environment, enthusiastic co workers, amazing patients ,
cons: difficulty with health system, large turnover of certain staff including front desk and medical assistants

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Lynn, MA
pros: You get 10 week paid vacation which is unheard of.
cons:
No structure
no organization
Pay does not meet market value

review_title: Great place to work; very busy
pros:
Great coworkers and patients 
Everyone cares for the community we serve
cons:
Not enough time for visits 
Number of patients expected to be seen per day
Low work life balance

review_title: Great place to start while you are in school
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Lynn, MA
pros:
Pretty Flexible schedule
Good management
The best co-workers
Knowledgeable providers
cons: Union based - yes are protected not to lose a job but your salary is sucks

job_title: Patient Access Manager in Lynn, MA
pros:
1. great benefits - you start to earn ET on day one of FT employment
2. Most Holidays off
3. Remote work available
4. Relatioship bulding with co-workers
cons:
1. Burn out is on the rise
2. Alot of projects at once
3. some unrealistic goals are sometimes set
4. Alot of back and forth with other staff (management level)
5. Too many people involved in the same project or department
6. Provider preference - high call out rate and no problem - non providers call out and its an issue
7. Blame

pros: helping the community get nutrition aid they need
cons: low pay was unfair for the amount of work and effort you put in.

review_title: Great Experience, Would be Tough to Go Back
job_title: Community Health Outreach Worker in Burlington, MA
pros: opportunity to step up and manage my team
cons: mismanaged and messy with unclear instruction at time

pros: Great for making a difference in the care of patients.
cons: Limited available parking, low pay

pros: friendly staff, diverse, room for some growth.
cons: unorganized at times, benefits not great compared to some other companies.

pros: Great co workers, very dedicated
cons: Not enough money or support

review_title: Good salary, well rounded benefits-- horrible leadership and senior management skills
job_title: Therapist LICSW, LMHC in Lynn, MA
pros: Co-workers are great, consultations with colleagues are welcome, receptionists are welcoming, patients are wonderful. Great community to work in. Possibility of gaining lots of hands on work experience.
cons: Non-clinical management making senior management decisions in BH department. Lack of communication between senior/administrative management to employees. Difficult to boost morale when no one trusts you or your work ethic. Absurd expectations which seems close to exploitation. They scale it as that's is why you get paid more than the average. Management really doesn't care about self care.

pros: Direct service providers (i,e., medical providers, nurses and therapists) are an amazing group of people who truly care about their clients and each other.  The mission of LCHC in terms of providing care for those most in need is an honorable one.
cons: Behavioral Health Senior Management is extremely difficult to work with.  They are micromanagers and do not value the input or needs of their teams.  It makes clinicians feel disrespected and not valued.

pros: Chances to work with a very diverse population and gain a ton of experience in various domains. Compressed work week available.
cons: Employees are micro-managed by literally everyone. There is a ton of turn over in every department therefore basically everyone is always in training mode. You have to get used to people screwing everything up that directly affects you and your patients.

job_title: Senior Billing Assistant in Lynn, MA
pros: people i worked with were nice.
cons: my hands were tied to do my job. i had to go through supervisor instead of calling co-worker with a problem or question directly. supervisor would get to it when he could. i never understood that.  direct communication would have made all our jobs run smoother and faster, no training for front desk/ check-in staff. medical billers have been doing tasks front desk workers should have done. very stressful. supervisors didn't have their teams backs. only wanted bodies there.

pros: Management change has brought a new and better structure. Hopefully, things will calm down and patient care and customer service will get better.
cons: Communication still seems to be lacking overall the organization even though there have been efforts to improve

pros: benefits, relationship with coworkers, first-time bonus
cons: burnout , provider-driven health center , unrealistic expectations, feel like you are made to fail, high turnover which causes burn out

review_title: Salary not the best but good benefits
pros: Very flexable and understanding to family needs. Great work/life balance.
cons: With large growth comes growing pains.

job_title: Psychiatric Mental Health NP-BC in Kennebunkport, ME
pros: Completed  nursing internship providing evaluation and counseling services in junior high school  system in Massachusetts
cons: Would have liked more extensive training

review_title: Experiences at Lynn Community Health Center
pros: Rewarding and challenging job with great benefits
cons: Challenging when using certified languages

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Nahant, MA
pros: The patients are very thankful
cons: The management staff are very political

pros: Very flexible, family oriented, management
cons: No good benefits, population, pay

pros: Good salary and nice co-workers.
cons: Hierarchical. Management (non-clinical) makes clinical decisions about patients without required training. Micromanagement. Co-workers morale is low. No recognition from management. More clinical staff thinking to leave as soon they find a better opportunity.
